finalProject

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalProject.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    The navigator is used to change either the robot's position or heading in a controlled manner. The navigator intakes values from the odometer continuously and should first move the robot towards its target position or target heading. During these movements the robot should consistently be the calling correction and obstacle avoidance methods to ensure the robot reaches the correct final position.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Ian Gauthier, Ilana Haddad, Tristan Bouchard, Tyrone Wong, Alexandre Tessier

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void avoidOb(double x_dest, double y_dest)
      This method should call the obstacle avoidance system when there has been a block detected, avoid the obstacle and then travel to the position that was initially the goal.
      void drive(double delta_x, double delta_y, double x_dest, double y_dest)
      This method should move the robot to by the given amount first in the x dimension and then in the y dimension all while continually calling the obstacle avoidance and correction classes to ensure that the robot is moving to the correct point.
      void driveDiag(double travelDist)
      This method travels to distance inputed diagonally.
      void driveWCorrection(double travelDist)
      This method is very similar to the drive method except that it should continuously call the corrected method for grid line correction to fix the heading of the robot as it moves to the final position.
      void driveYFIRST(double delta_x, double delta_y, double x_dest, double y_dest)
      This method is very similar to the original drive method except that it drives in the y dimension before driving in the x dimension.
      double[] getDest() 
      boolean isTurning() 
      void localize()
      This method should call the correction class' localization method and then when finished should call the robot to travel to the initial destination of the robot.
      void motorstop()
      This method is used to very quickly stop the robot from moving in whatever direction it is moving in before setting it's speed to be 150 degrees/second shortly afterward.
      void stopNav()
      This method should return an exception when the robot's navigation has been interrupted to alert the system of the interruption.

      The method moves the robot to the position that is inputed into the method by first traveling to (x,0) and then to (x,y), breaking it up into two steps.

      This method will travel to the coordinates x and y diagonally rather than split into x and y.
      void travelToYFIRST(double x_dest, double y_dest)
      This method is identical to the original travelTo method except that it moves in the y dimension before it moves in the x dimension.

      The method should intake an angle and then turn the robot to that angle.
      void turnToSmart(double angle)
      The method causes the robot to turn to an angle in relation to its current heading meaning that if 150 is input, the robot should turn 150 degrees

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x_dest,
            double y_dest)
        The method moves the robot to the position that is inputed into the method by first traveling to (x,0) and then to (x,y), breaking it up into two steps. Therefore, this method travels in straight lines rather than diagonally to final coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate that should be moved to
        y - the X coordinate that should be moved to

      • travelToDiag

        public void travelToDiag(double x,
                double y)
        This method will travel to the coordinates x and y diagonally rather than split into x and y. This should call the turnTo method to turn to the correct heading of the robot before finding the distance and moving that distance in a straight heading.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate that should be moved to
        y - the X coordinate that should be moved to

      • drive

        public void drive(double delta_x,
         double delta_y,
         double x_dest,
         double y_dest)
        This method should move the robot to by the given amount first in the x dimension and then in the y dimension all while continually calling the obstacle avoidance and correction classes to ensure that the robot is moving to the correct point. The grid line correction should be performed when the robot reaches each grid line and the localization correction should be performed after the robot has crossed over six grid lines since its last localization.
        Parameters:
        delta_x - the difference in x position from start to finish
        delta_y - the difference in y position from start to finish
        x_dest - the final x position
        y_dest - the final y position

      • avoidOb

        public void avoidOb(double x_dest,
           double y_dest)
        This method should call the obstacle avoidance system when there has been a block detected, avoid the obstacle and then travel to the position that was initially the goal.
        Parameters:
        x_dest - the x coordinate of the final position
        y_dest - the y coordinate of the final position

      • driveDiag

        public void driveDiag(double travelDist)
        This method travels to distance inputed diagonally.
        Parameters:
        travelDist -

      • driveWCorrection

        public void driveWCorrection(double travelDist)
        This method is very similar to the drive method except that it should continuously call the corrected method for grid line correction to fix the heading of the robot as it moves to the final position.
        Parameters:
        travelDist - the distance to be traveled

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        The method should intake an angle and then turn the robot to that angle.
        Parameters:
        theta - the angle which should be turned to

      • localize

        public void localize()
        This method should call the correction class' localization method and then when finished should call the robot to travel to the initial destination of the robot.

      • turnToSmart

        public void turnToSmart(double angle)
        The method causes the robot to turn to an angle in relation to its current heading meaning that if 150 is input, the robot should turn 150 degrees
        Parameters:
        angle - the amount to be turned

      • getDest

        public double[] getDest()
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the destination of the robot

      • isTurning

        public boolean isTurning()
        Returns:
        a boolean that is true if the robot it turning and false if it not

      • motorstop

        public void motorstop()
        This method is used to very quickly stop the robot from moving in whatever direction it is moving in before setting it's speed to be 150 degrees/second shortly afterward.

      • stopNav

        public void stopNav()
        This method should return an exception when the robot's navigation has been interrupted to alert the system of the interruption.

      • travelToYFIRST

        public void travelToYFIRST(double x_dest,
                  double y_dest)
        This method is identical to the original travelTo method except that it moves in the y dimension before it moves in the x dimension.
        Parameters:
        x_dest - the x coordinate of the final position
        y_dest - the y coordinate of the final position

      • driveYFIRST

        public void driveYFIRST(double delta_x,
               double delta_y,
               double x_dest,
               double y_dest)
        This method is very similar to the original drive method except that it drives in the y dimension before driving in the x dimension.
        Parameters:
        delta_x - the difference in x position from start to finish
        delta_y - the difference in y position from start to finish
        x_dest - the final x position
        y_dest - the final y position
